about.description:
Hey! My name is Falak Mandali, and I am a senior in Aeronautical and Astronautical Engineering, graduating in December 2024. Throughout my journey at Purdue, I've actively explored various fields to discover my true passion, which led me to Autonomy and Controls. Starting with an early interest in programming, I engaged in diverse hands-on experiences in manufacturing and design. Learning about electrical hardware and microcontrollers inspired me to pursue a minor in Electrical Engineering Technology, complementing my skills in control systems design.

Exploring different aspects of product design has been instrumental in understanding engineering from multiple perspectives. I've tackled challenges head-on, quickly learning and adapting to new skills. While it took some time to pinpoint my specialization, I made the most of Purdue's resources to grow my interests. Presenting at a prestigious conference and winning an award for my research solidified my commitment to designing and implementing advanced control systems.

My engineering education has taught me the importance of creating solutions for real-world problems. I'm excited to contribute and learn from leading engineering companies as a controls/robotics engineer, leveraging my diverse background and quick learning ability to drive innovation and excellence.

projects.name: Learning ROS2/Gazebo/PX4
projects.description: I am learning ROS2, Gazebo, and PX4-Autopilot for drone simulations in a Docker-based Ubuntu environment. I've developed ROS2 nodes for drone control and data acquisition, continuously enhancing my skills for implementing autonomous algorithms.

projects.name: Learning C++
projects.description: Recognizing the importance of object-oriented programming (OOP) in robotics, I learned C++ and applied OOP principles in projects, including creating data structures and a simplified chess game, enhancing my understanding of ROS2 node development.

projects.name: AAE 568 Project
projects.description: In this course, I learned to apply optimal estimators and control algorithms such as dynamic programming, the Kalman filter, and the Linear Quadratic Regulator. I applied my learning on a team-based class project.

projects.name: AAE 421 Project
projects.description: In this class I learned about flight vehicle dynamic formulation and linerization techniques, static and dynamics stability, and designing control systems to stabilise flight.

projects.name: ECET 224 & 179
projects.description: These courses enhanced my skills in electrical engineering technology, focusing on circuit design, microcontroller applications, and control automation using the Atmel Mega 2560 and Arduino Uno. I gained hands-on experience in C programming, digital-to-analog conversion, pulse width modulation, and using lab equipment like oscilloscopes and multimeters through weekly labs.

projects.name: Purdue Space Program
projects.description: The High Altitude team aimed to design a rocket capable of crossing the space line. This experience was a valuable opportunity to delve into the manufacturing, design, and build aspects of engineering. While it did not become my chosen career path, it provided me with a crucial understanding of the engineering design process.

projects.name: Engineering Projects in Community Service
projects.description: I participated in the EPICS learning community, where I initially served as Project Archivist for a playground design project and later became Project Manager for Team Global, overseeing multiple community service projects. My efforts earned me the Outstanding First-Year Student Award, and the experience solidified my passion for engineering by demonstrating its potential to solve real-world problems and help people.

experiences.description: This experience not only honed my technical skills in MATLAB, optimization, and parallel computing but also fostered a strong interest in electrical engineering and microcontroller coding, shaping my academic and career trajectory....

experiences.company: Flight Dynamics and Control Lab Research
experiences.description: This research experience provided a solid foundation in data-driven modeling and advanced my technical skills in MATLAB and LaTeX. The ongoing work in drone testing environments is expanding my expertise in robotics and simulation tools....

This research experience provided me with invaluable skills in system-level optimization, control co-design, and advanced MATLAB techniques. Presenting at a prestigious conference and winning an award was an incredible learning opportunity, giving me insight into graduate-level research. As my first research experience, it cemented my interest in pursuing graduate studies, deepening my knowledge, and contributing to engineering advancements....

I assist with student recruitment for the college of engineering at Purdue by interacting with prospective students and their families, both in-person and virtually. I provide insight into Purdue Engineering by sharing personal expereinces and knowledge gained from undergraudate experiences that would help the students identify if Purdue is the right fit fot them. Additionally, I often co-present at engineering information sessions that are presented everyday for students and families. Furthermore, I assist in the development of resources and marketing to improve guest experience as they navigate the resources provide by the Office of Future Engineers.

I serve as the first point of contact for students living in university dorms to assist with any issues with housing such lost keys, or roommate issues, and in getting their pacakges, along with helping them check-in and out of the dorms. During the summer terms, I additionally perform dorm safety checks and assist with hosting summer conferences.

I assisted students in understanding the concepts and approaching HWs for AAE 364, a Control Systems Analysis course. I hold help sessions, verify/create HW solutions, grade regrade requests, and proctor exams.

I trained at the design center to learn to do computer aided manufacturing (CAM) and to learn to use a CNC and manual machines. As a Peer Mentor, I assisted students for personal projects and Purdue design teams/student organizations with designing (CAD/CAM) and manufacturing their parts. I teach them how to use CNC and manual machines so they can manfucature their own parts.

I assisted students in understanding the fundamentals of coding and data analysis using Excel, Python, and MATLAB. I attended class sessions twice a week to assist students as they completed their team HWs and class projects, assisted in grading assignments, and gave reviews on exams and HWs.

I serve as a representative to prospective and admitted students exploring the field of aerospace engineering. I present at information sessions and tables, answers questions about engineering and college life, share personal experiences, and give them a tour. I also assist with organizing events for alumni and guest.

I serve as a mentor to freshmen and sophomores in the college of engineering who identify as a woman. I create a open 1:1 platform for students to discuss any academic or personal interests/issues and provide them with any resources and network to assist their college journey, and to learn from and grow with them.

educations.degree: Bachelor of Science in Aeronautical and Astronautical Engineering
educations.description:
Specializing in Autonomy and Controls
Minor in Electrical Engineering Technology

Dynamics & Vibrations | Aerodynamics | Control System Analysis |
Flight Dynamics & Control | Estimation and Control Lab | Aircraft Design |
Applied Optimal Control and Estimation | Statistical Methods | Electronic Systems |
Intro to Digital Systems | Embedded Digital Systems |

awards.title: Best Poster Award in the System Level Thermal Management Track
Outstanding First-Year Student & Community Engagement Award
awards.issuer: Engineering Projects at Community Service (EPICS) at Purdue
